title: Number of Contour Points
desc: Increasing the number of contour points will increase the accuracy of the electric field calculation but also the calculation time. The input should be an integer with a minimum value of 2.

title: Height Above Ground [m]
desc: Define the height above ground where the electric field should be calculated. Since the horizontal component of the electric field is ignored, the calculation is more accurate for lower heights above ground.

title: Horizontal Ground Points Start [m]
desc: Define the starting value of the ground points range.

title: Horizontal Ground Points End [m]
desc: Define the last value of the ground points range.

title: Number of Ground Points
desc: Number of points within the range where the electrical field will be computed.

title: Automatic Y-Axis Limits
desc: If switched on, the limits of the axis will be defined automatically and the values below are ignored.

title: Lower Y-Axis Limit [kV/cm]
desc: Manually define the lower axis limit.

title: Upper Y-Axis Limit [kV/cm]
desc: Manually define the upper axis limit.
